Yes - but it is only looking at the current point in your motion not the end point.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-17T16:48:34.318Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":93,"readers_count":92,"score":18.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458958,"topic_slug":"what-happens-at-the-end-of-a-ctre-motionmagic-move","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46442,"username":"eddieD","name":"Matt","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/898d66/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/what-happens-at-the-end-of-a-ctre-motionmagic-move/458958/4","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3335191,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T16:40:55.766Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eOK.  So I see a couple question marks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe main drive behind a Pid is the proportional term.  That is a constant times the error from your setpoint.  So if you tune the Pid to hold position, then when your mechanism is far away from the setpoint the error is large and you’ll just go full Throttle toward your set point.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBecause motion magic is an actual profile that controls to a velocity and acceleration, it is clear that the Pid is not being fully applied to the end setpoint.  If it were, your mechanism would just be going full Throttle.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-17T16:47:44.354Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":80,"readers_count":79,"score":21.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":458958,"topic_slug":"what-happens-at-the-end-of-a-ctre-motionmagic-move","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/what-happens-at-the-end-of-a-ctre-motionmagic-move/458958/5","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3335193,"name":"","username":"Dave1998","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/a88e57/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T16:45:30.358Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eBecause there’s a profile involved, you can have a high P gain, and not have it try to reach the goal immediately. When using a profile, the goal and setpoint become separated concepts - where the goal is your final wanted state, and the setpoint is constrained to your defined max velocity and acceleration. So the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePID\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Proportional Integral Derivative\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e is trying to compensate for the error between the measured state and the target \u003cem\u003esetpoint\u003c/em\u003e, not the target \u003cem\u003egoal\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-17T16:45:30.358Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":69.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458958,"topic_slug":"what-happens-at-the-end-of-a-ctre-motionmagic-move","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":7841,"username":"Tom_Line","name":"Tom Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60828,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-happens-at-the-end-of-a-ctre-motionmagic-move/458958/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3335198,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T16:46:37.684Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eA much better explanation than mine.
